msContents.summary: Letter of introduction from Asklepiades to Zenon asking him to assist the soldier Artemidoros in obtaining his land allotment

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 8 lines (Col. fr.); the address and docket in the back are written along the fibers
The Cairo fragment should be located at the bottom of Col.inv. 240; between the two there is a lacuna of up to 7 lines
Plate in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XX, pl. XXV
Letter received on the same day as it was written
Written in a large and attractive chancery hand, similar to those hands of the bureau of Apollonios; Asklepiades may have been an official in charge of payments of oil from the state store-house

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 37 (original no. 66) in Bell's inventory

div.ab:
Asklepiades, official formerly connected with oil [stores] in the district of Memphis, to Zenon, greeting. Artemidoros, who will present this letter to you, is a friend and fellow-citizen of mine. He has been sent with the rest of the soldiers to the land plots - - -
[Verso:] Year 33, Thoth 27. To Zenon. Asklepiades regarding Artemidoros.
